required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: AK104 in Locally Advanced MSI-H/dMMR Gastric Carcinoma and Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Trial of AK104(PD-1 and CTLA-4 Bispecific Antibody) in Locally Advanced MSI-H/dMMR Gastric Carcinoma and Colorectal Cancer During the Perioperative Period

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm, multicenter phase II clinical study. The aim is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and anti-tumor activities of AK104(a PD-1/CTLA-4 bispecific antibody) in MSI-H/dMMR locally advanced gastric adenocarcinoma and colorectal cancer during the perioperative period.Eligible patients will receive AK104 for three cycles before surgery and at most 6 months after surgery. The primary endpoint is the pathological complete response rate.

primary_outcome.measure: The rate of pathologic complete response(pCR%)
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The rate of pathologic complete response evaluated by investigator

clinical_study.condition: MSI-H/dMMR Gastric Carcinoma and Colorectal Cancer

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive AK104 by intravenous administration.

intervention.description: Subjects will receive AK104 by intravenous administration.
